snippet: The Federal Reserve said it does not consider politics when setting policy, but it is again poised to announce an economic stimulus effort during an election season.
abstract: Federal Reserve says it does not consider politics when setting policy, but is poised to announce an economic stimulus effort during this election season, like it did in 1992 when it cut its benchmark interest rate to 3 percent; decisions reached by Fed's policy-making committee will likely be judged through a political lens, as Republicans warn against taking action and Democrats lament that new actions are too little, too late.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve said it does not consider politics when setting policy, but it is again poised to announce an economic stimulus effort during an election season.

headline.seo: History Repeats as Fed Is Expected to Announce Economic Stimulus
headline.main: Economic Stimulus as the Election Nears? It’s Been Done Before
headline.print_headline: Economic Stimulus as the Election Nears? It’s Been Done Before
